body: LEAD: Several stores and a doctor's office in the Bath Beach section of Brooklyn suffered heavy damage early yesterday morning during a fire that burned for more than two hours before being brought under control, officials said. body: LEAD: A 48-year-old man was charged yesterday with killing two brothers and seriously wounding their mother and a teen-age girl, the police said. title: METRO DATELINES; Man Held in Killing Of Pair of Brothers

body: LEAD: Two brothers were killed and their mother and a teen-age girl were wounded yesterday when a man who had gone to the family's Brooklyn apartment looking for his missing daughter began shooting, the police said. title: 2 Brothers Killed in Shooting

body: LEAD: A New York City police officer who was arrested last July in the robbery of a bodega was arrested again Wednesday and charged with harassing a witness in that case, the police said yesterday. title: Arrested Officer Seized In Witness Harassment

body: LEAD: Mention tipping to most people and they will matter-of-factly suggest a gratuity of 15 percent. body: LEAD: Five men -three of them brothers - were arrested yesterday as members of a car-theft ring believed to be responsible for stealing as many as 360 cars a year off New York City streets. body: LEAD: A 12-year-old school integration policy intended to prevent white families from abandoning the New York City public school system is likely to be overhauled or even scrapped this fall, Robert F. title: New York City Considers Ending Its High School Integration Plan

body: LEAD: Three Guardian Angels were arrested Monday night after a trainee in the red-bereted civilian patrol group complained to the police that he had been assaulted by other Guardian Angels with fists and a sneaker. body: LEAD: A Brooklyn police officer has been arrested on robbery and kidnapping charges after an armed holdup at a bodega in East New York on Friday night, the police said. body: LEAD: Three investigators from the Brooklyn and Bronx Public Administrators' offices were arrested yesterday and charged with falsifying public records and stealing valuables from rooms they believed had been occupied by people who died without leaving a will. body: LEAD: Through a gantlet of residents, many of them screaming racial epithets, 450 blacks marched for three miles in the Bath Beach section of Brooklyn yesterday afternoon to protest racial discrimination in the city and, in particular, the beating of two black men in the neighborhood last week. title: Blacks, to Jeers of Whites, Protest Racism in Brooklyn
